definition: a long (usually round) rod of wood or metal or plastic, deoxidize molten metals by stirring them with a wooden pole
details:
noun
- a long (usually round) rod of wood or metal or plastic
- one of the two ends of a magnet where the magnetism seems to be concentrated
= synonyms: magnetic pole
- a long fiberglass sports implement used for pole vaulting
- a contact on an electrical device (such as a battery) at which electric current enters or leaves
= synonyms: terminal
- one of two divergent or mutually exclusive opinions
= example: one of two divergent or mutually exclusive opinions
- one of two antipodal points where the Earth's axis of rotation intersects the Earth's surface
- one of two points of intersection of the Earth's axis and the celestial sphere
= synonyms: celestial pole
- a square rod of land
= synonyms: rod
- a linear measure of 16.5 feet
= synonyms: rod
verb
- deoxidize molten metals by stirring them with a wooden pole
- support on poles
= example: support on poles
- propel with a pole
= example: propel with a pole
= synonyms: punt
